ee.sk.digidoc
Class SignedDoc

java.lang.Object
  ee.sk.digidoc.SignedDoc
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class SignedDoc
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents an instance of signed doc in DIGIDOC format. Contains one or more DataFile -s and zero or more Signature -s.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Veiko Sinivee
See Also:
Serialized Form

validate

public java.util.ArrayList validate(boolean bStrong)
Helper method to validate the whole SignedDoc object

Parameters:
bStrong - flag that specifies if Id atribute value is to be rigorously checked (according to digidoc format) or only as required by XML-DSIG
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

verify

public java.util.ArrayList verify(boolean checkDate,
                                  boolean demandConfirmation)
Helper method to verify the whole SignedDoc object. Use this method to verify all signatures

Parameters:
checkDate - Date on which to check the signature validity
demandConfirmation - true if you demand OCSP confirmation from every signature
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

verifyOcspOrCrl

public java.util.ArrayList verifyOcspOrCrl(boolean checkDate,
                                           boolean bUseOcsp)
Helper method to verify the whole SignedDoc object. Use this method to verify all signatures

Parameters:
checkDate - Date on which to check the signature validity
bUseOcsp - true if you demand OCSP confirmation from every signature. False if you want to check against CRL.
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

readCertificate

public static java.security.cert.X509Certificate readCertificate(java.lang.String certLocation)
                                                          throws DigiDocException
Reads the cert from a file, URL or from another location somewhere in the CLASSPATH such as in the librarys jar file.

Parameters:
certLocation - certificates file name, or URL. You can use url in form jar:// to read a certificate from the car file or some other location in the CLASSPATH
Returns:
certificate object
Throws:
DigiDocException

Returns:
